The highlighted icon is "hottest", not "custom"

The first icon refers to hottest

comments.content: I agree, hottest is highlighted, not custom/pinned

discussion.content: B. win-ces882ierw is one of your hottest Configuration Items (CIs), but is currently experiencing a low probability of anomalies

choices.D: win-ces882ierw is one of your customized list of monitored Configuration Items (CIs), but is currently experiencing a low probability of anomalies
choices.C: win-ces882ierw is one of your customized list of monitored Configuration Items (CIs) that is currently experiencing a high probability of anomalies and should be checked immediately
choices.A: win-ces882ierw is one of your hottest Configuration Items (CIs) that is currently experiencing a high probability of anomalies and should be checked immediately
choices.B: win-ces882ierw is one of your hottest Configuration Items (CIs), but is currently experiencing a low probability of anomalies

discussion.content: B. This requires a MID Web Server in addition to the MID Server.

choices.B: This requires a MID Web Server in addition to the MID Server.
choices.A: This requires a minimum of three MID Servers - two for Event Management and one additional MID Server dedicated for use by Operational Intelligence (OI).
choices.D: This requires a minimum of two MID Servers - one for Event Management and one additional MID Server dedicated for use by Operational Intelligence (OI).
choices.C: Nothing additional is required; this is handled by the MID Server.

questions.question_text: What are the server requirements to allow Operational Intelligence to successfully collect operational metric data via a push?
What would be an appropriate use case for having to write JavaScript in Event Management?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct.

choices.A: To change the value of the message key
choices.B: To create a custom action within a subflow
choices.C: To parse a node name out of your raw event data in an event rule

questions.question_text: A dynamic grouping of CIs based upon common criteria (filtered CI classes) that can be visualized in operator workspace is called?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
You can see service maps like this on the Operator Workspace
dashboard. Later in this tutorial, you will learn about the dashboard and
what an application service looks like when an alert is associated with a
CI.
Types of application services
Event Management classifies application services into the following
types:
Technical services
A technical service is a dynamic grouping of CIs based on some
common criteria. For example, a technical service could be comprised
of all web servers or all Oracle databases for a specific location, like
North America.
Application services
An application service can consist of discovered services, manual
services, or both. A discovered service is an application service
that the Service Mapping application finds (if your organization uses
Service Mapping). A manual service is an application service that your
administrator configures by selecting and adding each CI and specifying
the relationships between CIs.

Selected Answer: B
B is correct.
In the training material:
Technical services are published to service owners and typically underpin one or more business or application services. Dynamic CI Groups are technical services populated with a relationship to a CMDB group. It is a dynamic grouping of CIs based on common criteria like all Oracle databases in North America.
In older releases it was called "Technical service", but nowdays it is called Dynamic CI Group
